cells.data:
Pyramid blocks quarried from relatively nearby
Casing stones (smooth, white) from across the Nile
Granite in the bottom course of stone

Not concerned with regularity of stone, but with its stability

Egyptian architecture liked straight lines, but there's no adherence to standard plans
They don't conform themselves to a set structure

What is the Egyptian conception of death, 'moving on,' &c.? Very different! They don't limit it the way we do because the social reintigretation was social; you grieved socially rather than privately. They wanted to preserve the form as long as possible, contrary to most other cultural death cults where the deceased assimilates into another otherwordly structure.
